title: OPPO’s first in-house AP chip could launch as soon as next year
content:
Qualcomm and MediaTek may soon have some serious competition in the mobile chipset space. The Chinese smartphone maker OPPO is reportedly working on an in-house mobile chipset that will power its future smartphones. As per a report from the Chinese publication IT Home, OPPO’s IC design subsidiary Shanghai Zheku is developing an application processor (AP).

The post OPPO’s first in-house AP chip could launch as soon as next year appeared first on xda-developers.
description: The Chinese smartphone maker OPPO is reportedly working on an in-house mobile chipset that will power its future smartphones.
